repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:
`vim.treesitter.query.get` searches and reads query files every time
it's called, if user hasn't overridden the query. So this can incur
slowdown when called frequently. In fact, `get_folds_levels` might be
called very frequently [1].

Solution:
Cache the result of `vim.treesitter.query.get`.

[1]: For example, formatting markdown code block with `:h :range!`
triggers on_changedtree many times despite that the tree doesn't have
syntactic changes. In addition, the resulting fold is incorrect. Maybe a
bug? Regardless of whether these issues are bugs, it still makes sense
to reduce unnecessary IOs.

comment_data.body:
This looks like [another case](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/ff8e3c6039d50bdbc5b19ac468b77567cb79d04a/runtime/lua/vim/diagnostic.lua#L387) that could benefit from a generalized "memoize" / LRU mechanism.  #23233

Can you add a comment here like:

```lua
-- TODO: use generalized memoize / LRU. #23233
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -147,6 +147,22 @@ local function normalise_erow(bufnr, erow)
   return math.min(erow or max_erow, max_erow)
 end
 
+---@type table<string, Query|false|nil>
+--- `false` if query was not found
+local queries = {}
+
+---@return Query|nil
+local function get_query(lang)

comment_data.body: There's a memoize function in nvim-treesitter (main branch); that could be upstreamed.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -147,6 +147,22 @@ local function normalise_erow(bufnr, erow)
   return math.min(erow or max_erow, max_erow)
 end
 
+---@type table<string, Query|false|nil>
+--- `false` if query was not found
+local queries = {}
+
+---@return Query|nil
+local function get_query(lang)

comment_data.body: I thought ts.query.get is already cached?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -147,6 +147,23 @@ local function normalise_erow(bufnr, erow)
   return math.min(erow or max_erow, max_erow)
 end
 
+---@type table<string, Query|false|nil>
+--- `false` if query was not found
+local queries = {}
+
+-- TODO: use generalized memoize / LRU. #23233
+---@return Query|nil
+local function get_query(lang)
+  local query = queries[lang]
+  if query == false then
+    return nil
+  elseif query == nil then
+    query = ts.query.get(lang, 'folds')

comment_data.body:
No, it isn't. 
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/54807231c03495d6a322885d3ae7061e47cac490/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/query.lua#L210-L221

`explicit_queries` only stores queries set by `vim.treesitter.query.set()`, and `get_files` and `read_query_files` don't do caching either.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -147,6 +147,23 @@ local function normalise_erow(bufnr, erow)
   return math.min(erow or max_erow, max_erow)
 end
 
+---@type table<string, Query|false|nil>
+--- `false` if query was not found
+local queries = {}
+
+-- TODO: use generalized memoize / LRU. #23233
+---@return Query|nil
+local function get_query(lang)
+  local query = queries[lang]
+  if query == false then
+    return nil
+  elseif query == nil then
+    query = ts.query.get(lang, 'folds')

comment_data.body:
Ah we cache the parsing (https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/54807231c03495d6a322885d3ae7061e47cac490/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/query.lua#L251) but not the file reading.

Would it be possible to add the same parsing caching to file reading via a weak table?
comment_data.diff_hunk:

   return math.min(erow or max_erow, max_erow)
 end
 
+---@type table<string, Query|false|nil>

@@ -147,6 +147,23 @@ local function normalise_erow(bufnr, erow)
   return math.min(erow or max_erow, max_erow)
 end
 
+---@type table<string, Query|false|nil>
+--- `false` if query was not found
+local queries = {}
+
+-- TODO: use generalized memoize / LRU. #23233
+---@return Query|nil
+local function get_query(lang)
+  local query = queries[lang]
+  if query == false then

comment_data.body: Better change this and the one below to: `table<string,table<string, Query|false>>`
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -195,6 +195,12 @@ function M.set(lang, query_name, text)
   explicit_queries[lang][query_name] = M.parse(lang, text)
 end
 
+--- `false` if query files didn't exist or were empty
+---@type {[string]: {[string]: Query|false}}

@@ -195,6 +195,12 @@ function M.set(lang, query_name, text)
   explicit_queries[lang][query_name] = M.parse(lang, text)
 end
 
+--- `false` if query files didn't exist or were empty
+---@type {[string]: {[string]: Query|false}}

comment_regular_data.body: If the problem lies with `vim.treesitter.query.get`, shouldn't there be a way to improve/cache inside `query.get` directly?

> If the problem lies with vim.treesitter.query.get, shouldn't there be a way to improve/cache inside query.get directly?

I agree. In fact, there are quite a few places that implement caching themselves.

* https://github.com/nvim-treesitter/nvim-treesitter/blob/3fde1587d0850d46b5a1473e5d1e59254e947496/lua/nvim-treesitter/query.lua#L106
* https://github.com/folke/noice.nvim/blob/6c87c1d11c38180fb72bf8f45518a0a3e081afc1/lua/noice/text/treesitter.lua#L25

But note that their behavior is slightly different from this PR's implementation: mine remembers whether `query.get` has failed. Incidentally, I think `vim.treesitter.get_parser`'s cache should behave like that (see https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/23964).

> For example, formatting markdown code block with :h :range! [...]. In addition, the resulting fold is incorrect. Maybe a bug? 

This indeed seems to be a bug in `:h range!`.
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/2031812348e79e3d854d444b53e69340ab42e5dd/src/nvim/ex_cmds.c#L1240-L1253

`on_bytes` is called when adjusting extmarks, but `do_filter` doesn't adjust extmarks.

> I agree. In fact, there are quite a few places that implement caching themselves.

> https://github.com/nvim-treesitter/nvim-treesitter/blob/3fde1587d0850d46b5a1473e5d1e59254e947496/lua/nvim-treesitter/query.lua#L106

Note: that's already been removed on the `main` (future 1.0) branch. (That duplication was just a historical artifact long due for excision.)

Can't `query_get_cache` and `explicit_queries` be re-used? Looks like they do the same (cache by lang+query_name). Maybe `M.set` can just add to `query_get_cache` since it should override any runtime queries?

They have slightly different meanings. For `query_get_cache`, we're ok with its entries being removed because it's just a cache (so it's a weak table). But for `explicit_queries`, the entry must not be removed.

Ok, thank you.

Sorry for offtop. If I `query.get()` and don't save result anywhere, does it mean that garbage collector will collect it pretty soon and cache will be useless? I already noticed some time ago that `query.get` is not cached. For this reason I explicitly did `query.set()` with string instead of placing queries in rtp. But with weak table cache I suspect this change won't help me to just place queries in rtp. I still need to save resulting query somewhere, right?
Yes, it will be gc'd. The benefits occur when the query needs to be used in quick succession, so it's not useless but will be cleared relatively quickly.

title: perf(treesitter): cache fold query
